mata_info.quick_summary: For Producer Companies, annual compliance requires filing Form MGT-7 for the annual return and Form AOC-4 for financial statements on the MCA portal. Include details on financial performance, member information, and adherence to Producer Company regulations. Timely submission is crucial for regulatory compliance and to avoid penalties.

seo.title: Understanding Annual Compliance Requirements for Producer Companies
seo.description: Producer Companies in India, focused on agricultural production and post-harvest activities, must adhere to specific annual compliance requirements. This includes filing annual returns, maintaining proper financial records, and conducting necessary meetings. This guide provides a comprehensive overview of the annual compliance obligations for Producer Companies, ensuring they meet regulatory standards and operate smoothly.
keywords: Annual compliance guide for Producer Companies

content:
What is a Producer Company?:

A Producer Company means a company that is formed with a purpose of engaging in any activity that is connected to or relatable to any primary produce. In other words, a Producer Company is a company that is formed with a primary objective of production, harvesting, procurement, grading, pooling, handling, marketing, selling, port of primary produce of the members or import of goods or services for their benefits.

Here, “produce” are the products that have been grown or produced by farming. This means that, a Producer Company primarily is engaged with agriculture and post-harvest processing activities.

Annual Compliance of the Producer Company :

  • Annual Compliance refers to specific forms that the Companies are required to file with the Registrar of the Companies during a year.
  • Be it any type of company, to adhere to the Annual ROC Compliance is mandatory.
  • The Producer Company needs to file the Balance Sheet, P&L Account and other documents with MCA.
  • Hence, being a Producer Company, you need to file your Annual Compliance Forms correctly on a regular basis in order to ensure that your company gets good legal standing. The Following are the main annual compliance for a Producer Company.

Advantages of Complying with the Annual Compliance for Producer Company:

  • Credibility and Transparency :

    Compliance is mandatory for Producer Company. When the company is regular with Annual

  • Active Status:

    Non-filing or defaults in complying with the Annual Filing for Producer Company may result in striking off the name of the Company by the Registrar of Company. Hence, Annual Compliance helps in maintaining active status.

  • Assures Investors and customers:

    Annual Compliance creates a competitive advantage for the Producer Company in the market. This can be useful to advertise the business and assure the investors and customers about the company’s business.

  • Avoiding Penalties:

    Regularity in filing the Annual Compliance helps the Producer Company to avoid the heavy penalties.

isGridPints.head: What are the Major Annual Compliance for Producer Company?
isGridPints.sub_head: Points to make your decision easy

list.head: Form MBP 1
list.subhead: Every director shall, in its first board meeting, disclose any interest in any company, firm, or other AOI (including any shareholding interest) by filing Form MBP 1.

list.head: Form DIR 8
list.subhead: Every Director of the Company must file the disclosure of non-disqualification in each Financial Year.

list.head: Form MGT 7
list.subhead: The Producer Company is required to file an Annual Return in Form MGT-7 regarding the latest information about the directors and shareholders of the Producer Company.

list.head: Form AOC 4
list.subhead: Financial Statements in Form AOC-4 must be filed with the Balance Sheet, Profit and Loss Account, Directors’ Report, Cash Flow Statement, Auditor’s Report, and the Consolidated Financial Statement.

list.head: Form ADT 1
list.subhead: The auditor for the Company must be appointed by the Board of Directors within 30 days from the Date of Incorporation of the Company. The appointment must be filed in ADT-1.

list.head: DIR-3 KYC
list.subhead: All directors are required to file a form to complete the KYC with the RoC in form DIR 3 KYC. If already submitted, verification of OTP over email and mobile number is required. New directors need to submit this form.

list.head: Form DPT 3
list.subhead: The Return of Deposit should be filed before the Registrar of Companies in FORM DPT-3.

left.question: What is the Annual Return for Producer Company?
left.answer: An Annual Return contains the details of a company’s share capital, indebtedness, directors, shareholders, changes in directorships, corporate governance disclosures, etc.

left.question: Who signs the Annual Return?
left.answer: The Annual Return must be signed by two directors of the company.

left.question: Are the Government fees for Company return filing included in ROC filing fees?
left.answer: Yes, Seller Success’s packages for ROC filing fees are inclusive of the government fees for company return filings.

left.question: Does a Non-Working Producer Company require to comply with the Annual Compliance, even if the Producer Company is not working?
left.answer: Yes, irrespective of the working or non-working status of the Producer Company, it is required to file all the necessary Annual Compliance Forms with ROC.

right.question: Does a Producer Company require to hold Board Meetings? How many in a year?
right.answer: Yes, a Producer Company is required to hold a minimum of 4 Board Meetings each year, with a gap of no more than 3 months between two meetings.

right.question: What do you mean by Financial Statement?
right.answer: A Financial Statement refers to the Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Statement, along with the Directors’ Report and Auditors’ Report. This statement must be filed in the appropriate format as prescribed by the company and should include a declaration on the state of solvency of the company. It is the responsibility of the directors to ensure this filing.
